channel.title: Need some help please
channel.description:
ive found the prob but cant fix idk how
well lets say i run server fine then run uttoent and the port is taking up and if i run uttorent the the server it says port alredy in use hmmm...?
kinda comfusing ey any help apreeciated
would rep++ if i could

item.title: Need some help please
item.dc:creator: @aaronvdw aaronvdw
item.description:
@aaronvdw wrote:

utorrnent blows anyway… it gives much more lagg. But to open up a port , you need to put your firewall open.

UCP - port ####
TCP - port ####

= same port , u need both ways…

Read full topic

item.title: Need some help please
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

I used to have McAfee but I can’t remember exactly what to do. It wasn’t exactly rocket science at the time anyway, I was only about 10. Just go to the UI, take your brains with you, and look for the port unblocker.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some help please
item.dc:creator: @ionforeva ionforeva
item.description:
@ionforeva wrote:

but mate my windows firewall is shutdown but i hva mcafee on anyone know what to do with it?

Read full topic

item.title: Need some help please
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

Go to your connection properties, advanced, then firewall settings. Then just add the exceptions there for the port your server is running on. I’m not sure if it needs UDP and TCP so just do both for good measure.

Read full topic

get glasses

item.title: Need some help please
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

[quote=“pkakidjr1, post:4, topic:281784”][quote author=The cook from runescape link=topic=372366.msg2809927#msg2809927 date=1243936203]
Don’t be so stupid μTorrent isn’t a port opening tool, just do it manually on your firewall.
[/quote]Oo you can do that? I heard you had to drop your firewall to do it.[/quote]
You can, but as I said it’s a stupid way of doing it. I think people are running μTorrent to open their ports because it adds an exception to the Windows firewall, but you can easily do it manually without having to run μTorrent with your server so there’s no point. Just go to the Windows firewall settings from connection properties and add an exception.

Read full topic
